description.html: Returns a string representing the base URL of the document containing the Node.
description.text:
Returns a string representing the base URL of the document
      containing the Node.

description.html: Returns a live NodeList containing all the children of this node (including elements, text and comments). NodeList being live means that if the children of the Node change, the NodeList object is automatically updated.
description.text:
Returns a live NodeList containing all the children of this node
      (including elements, text and comments). NodeList being live means that
      if the children of the Node change, the NodeList object is
      automatically updated.

description.html: Returns a Node representing the first direct child node of the node, or null if the node has no child.
description.text:
Returns a Node representing the first direct child node of the node,
      or null if the node has no child.

description.html: A boolean indicating whether or not the Node is connected (directly or indirectly) to the context object, e.g. the Document object in the case of the normal DOM, or the ShadowRoot in the case of a shadow DOM.
description.text:
A boolean indicating whether or not the Node is connected (directly or indirectly)
      to the context object, e.g. the Document object in the case of the
      normal DOM, or the ShadowRoot in the case of a shadow DOM.

description.html: Returns a Node representing the last direct child node of the node, or null if the node has no child.
description.text:
Returns a Node representing the last direct child node of the node,
      or null if the node has no child.

description.html: Returns a Node representing the next node in the tree, or null if there isn't such node.
description.text:
Returns a Node representing the next node in the tree, or
      null if there isn't such node.

description.html: Returns a string containing the name of the Node. The structure of the name will differ with the node type. E.g. An HTMLElement will contain the name of the corresponding tag, like 'audio' for an HTMLAudioElement, a Text node will have the '#text' string, or a Document node will have the '#document' string.
description.text:
Returns a string containing the name of the Node. The
      structure of the name will differ with the node type. E.g. An
      HTMLElement will contain the name of the corresponding tag, like
      'audio' for an HTMLAudioElement, a Text
      node will have the '#text' string, or a Document node will
      have the '#document' string.

description.html: Returns an unsigned short representing the type of the node. Possible values are:
description.text:
Returns an unsigned short representing the type of the node. Possible
      values are:
    
    
      
        
          Name
          Value
        
      
      
        
          ELEMENT_NODE
          1
        
        
          ATTRIBUTE_NODE
          2
        
        
          TEXT_NODE
          3
        
        
          CDATA_SECTION_NODE
          4
        
        
          PROCESSING_INSTRUCTION_NODE
          7
        
        
          COMMENT_NODE
          8
        
        
          DOCUMENT_NODE
          9
        
        
          DOCUMENT_TYPE_NODE
          10
        
        
          DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT_NODE
          11

description.html: Returns / Sets the value of the current node.
description.text: Returns / Sets the value of the current node.

description.html: Returns the Document that this node belongs to. If the node is itself a document, returns null.
description.text:
Returns the Document that this node belongs to. If the node is itself
      a document, returns null.

description.html: Returns a Node that is the parent of this node. If there is no such node, like if this node is the top of the tree or if doesn't participate in a tree, this property returns null.
description.text:
Returns a Node that is the parent of this node. If there is no such
      node, like if this node is the top of the tree or if doesn't participate in a tree,
      this property returns null.

description.html: Returns an Element that is the parent of this node. If the node has no parent, or if that parent is not an Element, this property returns null.
description.text:
Returns an Element that is the parent of this node. If the node has
      no parent, or if that parent is not an Element, this property returns
      null.

description.html: Returns a Node representing the previous node in the tree, or null if there isn't such node.
description.text:
Returns a Node representing the previous node in the tree, or
      null if there isn't such node.

description.html: Returns / Sets the textual content of an element and all its descendants.
description.text: Returns / Sets the textual content of an element and all its descendants.

description.html: Adds the specified childNode argument as the last child to the current node. If the argument referenced an existing node on the DOM tree, the node will be detached from its current position and attached at the new position.
description.text:
Adds the specified childNode argument as the last child to the current node.
      If the argument referenced an existing node on the DOM tree, the node will be detached
      from its current position and attached at the new position.

description.html: Clone a Node, and optionally, all of its contents. By default, it clones the content of the node.
description.text:
Clone a Node, and optionally, all of its contents. By default, it
      clones the content of the node.

description.html: Compares the position of the current node against another node in any other document.
description.text: Compares the position of the current node against another node in any other document.

description.html: Returns true or false value indicating whether or not a node is a descendant of the calling node.
description.text:
Returns true or false value indicating whether or not a node is a
      descendant of the calling node.

description.html: Returns the context object's root which optionally includes the shadow root if it is available.
description.text: Returns the context object's root which optionally includes the shadow root if it is available.

description.html: Returns a boolean value indicating whether or not the element has any child nodes.
description.text: Returns a boolean value indicating whether or not the element has any child nodes.

description.html: Inserts a Node before the reference node as a child of a specified parent node.
description.text:
Inserts a Node before the reference node as a child of a specified
      parent node.

description.html: Accepts a namespace URI as an argument and returns a boolean value with a value of true if the namespace is the default namespace on the given node or false if not.
description.text:
Accepts a namespace URI as an argument and returns a boolean value with a
      value of true if the namespace is the default namespace on the given node
      or false if not.

description.html: Returns a boolean value which indicates whether or not two nodes are of the same type and all their defining data points match.
description.text:
Returns a boolean value which indicates whether or not two nodes are of the
      same type and all their defining data points match.

description.html: Returns a boolean value indicating whether or not the two nodes are the same (that is, they reference the same object).
description.text:
Returns a boolean value indicating whether or not the two nodes are
      the same (that is, they reference the same object).

description.html: Returns a string containing the prefix for a given namespace URI, if present, and null if not. When multiple prefixes are possible, the result is implementation-dependent.
description.text:
Returns a string containing the prefix for a given namespace URI,
      if present, and null if not. When multiple prefixes are possible, the
      result is implementation-dependent.

description.html: Accepts a prefix and returns the namespace URI associated with it on the given node if found (and null if not). Supplying null for the prefix will return the default namespace.
description.text:
Accepts a prefix and returns the namespace URI associated with it on the given node
      if found (and null if not). Supplying null for the prefix
      will return the default namespace.

description.html: Clean up all the text nodes under this element (merge adjacent, remove empty).
description.text: Clean up all the text nodes under this element (merge adjacent, remove empty).

description.html: Removes a child node from the current element, which must be a child of the current node.
description.text:
Removes a child node from the current element, which must be a child of the current
      node.

description.html: Replaces one child Node of the current one with the second one given in parameter.
description.text:
Replaces one child Node of the current one with the second one given
      in parameter.
